item.title: Dual Carriageway Ahead sign on B4213, 7th February
item.description:
Dual Carriageway Ahead sign, approaching A38 junction, damaged and misaligned, possible danger to passing traffic. Same problem as before, clearly not repaired well enough or struck heavily. https://what3words.com/ below.unguarded.admire
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4213, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign bracket is hanging/fallen off (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 7th February
item.description:
Customer reports a series of two potholes at the location: one is approximately 12ft long, the other around 2ft by 1ft and around 1-2 inches deep. They are unavoidable and the suspension on their vehicle has collapsed as a consequence of being unable to steer around them.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised Paving Slabs, 7th February
item.description:
Several paving slabs outside of No 1 (GL51 6BE) are now raised after a delivery of a skip today. This has already caused an accident as I saw my elderly neighbour trip over it a short while ago causing bruising to his knees etc. I went out to help him up, apart from bruising he is fine. Infact several slabs are raised around the Close.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sheepscombe Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole forming around ironwork, 7th February
item.description:
Another reasonably deep pothole is forming around ironwork on Typhoon Way and tarmac on the road is also cracking.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Typhoon Way, Upton St. Leonards, Stroud
Report on FixMyStreet
